titleStmt.title: W. D. Greer et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To His Excellency Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

The undersigned petitioners would respectfully state that at the February term of the Livingston Circuit Court of Kentucky there was assessed against John S. Myrick a fine of sixty Dollars & costs for Keeping a Tippling House we would state that Mr Myrick is a poor man & is probably unable to pay said fine & is an old man & that from what we have been informed there was considerable doubt as to John S. Myrick being the man that was guilty of the offense.
We therefore request your Excellency to exercise clemency in this case & remit the fine against Mr Myrick.

W. D. Greer
A. M. Barnett
S. S. Barnett
M. T. Dunn
K B Johnson
Geo. Berry
C. A. Berry
N. B. Barnett
W. H. H.. Wilson
